definition: to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
to fall/to degenerate
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: She degraded herself by cheating and telling lies.
He is a man who would stoop to anything .
sentences.chinese: 他是一個自甘墮落，什麼事都乾的傢伙。

sentences.english: Clara might have stooped to listen at the door .
sentences.chinese: 克萊拉很可能自甘墮落，躲在門口偷聽過。

sentences.english: He alone sinks to the rear and the slaves!
sentences.chinese: 他自甘墮落成俯首貼耳的奴隸。

sentences.english: The road to positivity is strewn with the abandoned vehicles of the faint-hearted.
sentences.chinese: 通往樂觀的道路上佈滿了膽怯和自甘墮落的車輛。

sentences.english: Have too many helpless, is still self-abandonment , thoroughly the heart die.
sentences.chinese: 有太多的無奈，還是自甘墮落，徹底心死吧。

sentences.english: I will be sad, but it will not remain to corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 我會難過，但是不會自甘墮落。

sentences.english: And man hath bowed himself down, and man hath been debased: therefore forgive them not.
sentences.chinese: 如此，人自甘卑下，自甘墮落，對他們決無救援。

definition: fight to the death/desperate struggle
equestrianism/horsemanship
feudalism
downhearted/downcast/in despair
to write off at one stroke
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
to be chivalrous
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to execute by hanging
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
